SEARCH
Package com.example.app

Class InventoryController.InventoryItem

java.lang.Object
com.example.app.InventoryController.InventoryItem
Enclosing class:
InventoryController
public static class InventoryController.InventoryItem extends Object
Represents an inventory item with all relevant details.

This inner class encapsulates data for a single inventory item, including identification, quantities, pricing, and automatically determines category based on the ingredient name.

Since:
2025-10-20
Version:
1.0.1
Author:
Abhinav, Avi, Bhavana, Ethan, Zayna

  • Constructor Details

    • InventoryItem

      public InventoryItem(int ingredientId, String name, int amountOnHand, int amountRequired, String unit, double pricePerUnit)
      Constructs an InventoryItem with the specified details.
      Parameters:
      ingredientId - the unique identifier for this ingredient
      name - the name of the ingredient
      amountOnHand - the current quantity in stock
      amountRequired - the minimum required quantity
      unit - the unit of measurement (e.g., "oz", "lbs", "units")
      pricePerUnit - the cost per unit

    • getCategory

      public String getCategory()
      Determines and returns the category of this ingredient based on its name.

      Categories are assigned by matching keywords in the ingredient name:

      • Toppings: contains "boba", "pearl", or "jelly"
      • Beverages: contains "tea" or "coffee"
      • Dairy: contains "milk"
      • Flavoring: contains "syrup", "concentrate", or "powder"
      • Supplies: contains "cup", "straw", "lid", "napkin", or "carrier"
      • Other: default category if no keywords match
      Returns:
      the category string
